newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Police kill seven in Bangladesh land battle.
newsitem.headline: Police kill seven in Bangladesh land battle.

text.p: Seven people were killed and dozens injured when police opened fire on villagers north of Dhaka over a land dispute, local officials said on Saturday.
One police officer said more than 100 people were hurt.
The officials said the auxiliary police, known as Ansars, were called in on Friday to evict people occupying a vacant site.

"The unlawful occupiers started a battle with Ansars and at one stage, reinforced by villagers, attacked them with lethal weapons," one police officer at Savar, 40 km (25 miles) from Dhaka, told reporters.
"The Ansars opened fire in self-defence. Seven people were killed and over 100 injured in clashes," he said without giving details.
Savar residents said on Saturday the situation was tense and villagers were regrouping for a possible backlash.
